title: Greene County Airport (Pennsylvania)
text:
Greene County Airport is a county-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> in <a href="Franklin%20Township%2C%20Greene%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Franklin Township</a>, <a href="Greene%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Greene County, Pennsylvania</a>, United States. It is located two <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (4 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) east of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Waynesburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">Waynesburg, Pennsylvania</a>. This airport was included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2009–2013, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Greene County Airport covers an area of 89 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (36 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 1,069 feet (326 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 9/27 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,500 by 75 feet (1,067 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending April 21, 2011, the airport had 13,909 aircraft operations, an average of 38 per day: 99% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 1% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and <1% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 25 aircraft based at this airport: 96% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 4% <a href="ultralight">ultralight</a>.
